subprocess_flow.description: The HR Manager initiates the job specification process by collecting detailed role requirements from the hiring manager. This includes the necessary skills, experience, educational background, and key responsibilities for the position. The HR Manager also clarifies any specific needs or expectations for the role to ensure a comprehensive understanding.

Using the documented role requirements and industry standards, the GenAI platform generates an initial draft of the job description. The GenAI tool leverages its training data to create a well-structured and informative job description that includes a summary of the role, key responsibilities, required skills, and qualifications. The draft is designed to be a starting point for further refinement by HR.
success_criteria: GenAI generates a complete draft job description
Draft includes all key elements (summary, responsibilities, skills)

subprocess_flow.description: The HR Manager reviews the GenAI-generated draft job description and refines it to ensure accuracy, clarity, and compliance with company policies and legal regulations. This includes verifying the job title, responsibilities, required skills, and qualifications. The HR Manager also adjusts the language to align with the company's tone and culture, ensuring the job description is engaging and attractive to potential candidates.
success_criteria: Job description is accurate and clear
Compliance with company policies and legal regulations
Alignment with company tone and culture

subprocess_flow.description: If the role involves sensitive responsibilities or requires specific legal compliance, the edited job description is sent to the Legal Counsel for review. The Legal Counsel ensures that the job description does not contain any discriminatory language or violate any employment laws. This step is crucial for mitigating legal risks and ensuring ethical hiring practices.
success_criteria: Legal Counsel approves the job description

subprocess_flow.description: The HR Manager submits the edited job description (and legal approval, if applicable) to the hiring manager for final approval. The hiring manager reviews the job description to ensure it accurately reflects the role requirements and aligns with their expectations. Once approved, the job description is considered final and ready for use in the recruitment process.
success_criteria: Hiring manager approves the job description
Job description is final and ready for recruitment
